title: Application Specialist Microsoft 365 till Matas Group
description:
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens digitala arbetsplats?
   

  

 Matas Group söker nu en erfaren och affärsdriven Application Specialist inom Microsoft 365.
   

  

 I denna roll får du möjlighet att arbeta strategiskt och operativt med att utveckla och optimera plattformen, samtidigt som du stödjer verksamheten i en pågående IT-transformation.
   

  

**Din vardag:**
 Som Application Specialist inom Microsoft 365 har du en nyckelroll i att säkerställa en effektiv och modern digital arbetsmiljö. Du arbetar nära verksamhetens olika avdelningar för att identifiera behov, driva förbättringsinitiativ och utveckla användningen av M365-plattformen. En central del av rollen är att skapa utbildningsmaterial och vägleda organisationen i att nyttja systemets fulla potential.
   

  

 Du ansvarar för administration, konfiguration och vidareutveckling av tjänster som Exchange, SharePoint, Teams och OneDrive. Du hanterar avancerad support på 2nd och 3rd line-nivå samt har en aktiv dialog med Microsoft och andra leverantörer för att bevaka och implementera nya funktioner.
   

  

 Vidare deltar du i strategiska projekt för att forma en sammanhållen svensk-dansk IT-miljö, där du ges stort eget ansvar att driva utvecklingen framåt.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi ser gärna att du har teknisk förståelse för Microsoft 365 och en stark affärsmässig förmåga. Du trivs i en rådgivande roll där du kan omsätta tekniska möjligheter till värdeskapande lösningar för verksamheten.
   

  

 Som person är du analytisk, proaktiv och har ett strukturerat arbetssätt. Din kommunikationsförmåga gör att du kan hantera både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter på ett pedagogiskt sätt.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:**
* Gedigen erfarenhet från en liknande roll gärna inom Microsoft 365-administration och utveckling
* Djup teknisk kunskap om M365-tjänster (Exchange, SharePoint, Teams, OneDrive) och deras administration
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla och implementera digitala arbetssätt och processer
* Förmåga att skapa tydlig och strukturerad dokumentation för både tekniska och icke-tekniska målgrupper
* Erfarenhet av att hålla utbildningar och vägleda verksamheten i tekniska förändringar
* Starkt affärsdriv och vana att arbeta i en organisation under förändring
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och fatta beslut baserade på analys och verksamhetsförståelse
* Strukturerat helhetsperspektiv med förmåga att hantera både strategi och detaljnivå
* Flytande engelska och svenska, samt god förståelse för nordiska språk


**Om Matas Group**
 Matas Group är en nordisk ledare inom skönhet och välbefinnande med en omsättning på över 7,6 miljarder DKK, 500+ butiker, 4 000+ anställda, 5+ miljoner lojalitetsmedlemmar och webbshoppar i Danmark, Sverige, Norge och Finland.
   

  

 Matas Group driver två detaljhandelskedjor i Norden: Matas i Danmark och KICKS i Sverige, Norge och Finland. Företaget erbjuder ett brett utbud av externa varumärken, egna varumärken samt en stark fokus på hög service, personlig rådgivning och expertis.
   

  

 Matas Group är noterat på Nasdaq OMX Köpenhamn.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Matas Group med Wise IT. Vill du veta mer, kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Sandra Åhs på sandra.ahs@wiseit.se.
   

  

 Vi kan tyvärr inte ta emot ansökningar via mail då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.
   

  

 Vi hanterar alla ansökningar löpande och även så urvalet av kandidater som går vidare till intervju.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Network Data Section Manager
description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".
   

  

 We are now looking for a
 **Network Data** 
 to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Marketing Knowledge & Data Analytics Manager.
   

  

**How you can contribute and have an impact?**
* Ensure we get profitability data (eBM/DSPM) from networks and ensure our customer data flows for right level of customer data from dealers. Collection of network data. Interaction with DMS providers
* Responsible for the preparation, extrapolation and analysis of network and profitability + Dealer data integration
* Analyze Dealer performance and profitability (example : Market View & eBM)
* Responsible of providing data for Fall-down and Escalation process
* Provide to Franchise team / Big Group team with financial and performance reports to support candidate negotiations (D&B Risk tool and/ or eBM)
* Prepare benchmarks and support Franchise team / Big Group team to facilitate dealer eBM reviews and proposals for individual dealer improvement
* Ensure sufficient training (internal) for dealer systems (example: Market View & eBM)
* Manage systems and stake holders in connection to dealer systems (eg. Market View & eBM) and any dealer system integration projects (eg. DDI)
* Network Data purchase and update (TIV, registration, UIO data, dealer profitability etc.)
* Control budget related to the dealer data and systems
* Managing special projects and ad-hoc reporting and analysis for regional and national management


**What we look for:**
* Minimum 5 years professional experience preferably within the automotive industry, EV experience is a plus
* Experience within an international, matrix organization is highly advantageous
* Experience in Finance (financial statements) & Cost accounting
* Experience in Data management/engineering
* Higher education at Bachelors' level
* Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage
* Analytical skills
* Advanced PC skills
* Experienced MS Office user, especially in Excel
* Presentation skills
* Understanding of financial statements and experience from financial tools
* Data-driven decision-making
* Borderless and virtual mindset
* Ability to simplify
* Familiarity with data Management principles and practices
* Experience creating and documenting policies and procedures
* Ability to work with both business stakeholders and technical support teams to resolve data issues
* Ability to communicate successfully with stakeholders at all levels to understand their needs and translate those needs
* Ability to communicate with highly technical individuals about the desires, insights, and observations of the business and to ensure development and deployment of appropriate solutions


 Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.
   

  

 Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.
   

  

 Amsterdam Netherlands

title: Risk Modelling and Actuarial Analyst
description:
Are you eager to kick-start your career at one of the world's leading advisory and audit firms? At PwC, we are driven by the use of our creativity, experience, and the latest technology to generate value for our clients. This drive is shared among everyone working with us, and together, we tackle complex challenges, foster business development, and have a positive impact on society. If you have the right mindset, we have thousands of opportunities for you to contribute to a better future.
   

  

**What value you bring as a Risk Modelling and Actuarial Analyst**
 As a Risk Modelling And Actuarial Analyst Within PwC, You Will Be Involved In Varying Types Of Client Projects And Topics, Such As
   

  

* Calculating, validating and reporting technical provisions and solvency capital for insurance and occupational pension companies.
* Valuation of insurance and occupational pension contracts and portfolios.
* Implementation of insurance-related regulations.
* Actuarial work within the areas of data analytics, digital and technology transformations and artificial intelligence.
* Risk modelling of diverse risks categories, including insurance risks, market risks, credit risk, cyber risks and climate risks.
* External and internal audit work.


 You will be part of our Financial Services Risk and Regulation department in Stockholm. Many of our projects are conducted through cross-competency teams with participants from various departments, allowing us to bring the right skills to our clients. Team members have the possibility to exchange knowledge and learn from each other, with an expectation to influence and contribute through their own experiences and skills to the project’s successful completion. In addition to working with local colleagues, you will also have regular contact with colleagues in our Nordic and international offices.
   

  

 Given the variety of projects and breadth of our business, we expect you to enjoy a fast learning curve. On a longer-term perspective, we offer numerous development paths within PwC, ranging from data and analytics work within other industries to secondment opportunities within our international network.
   

  

 We will support you in your efforts towards achieving an actuarial education and diploma.
   

  

**What are we looking for in this position?**
 As a person, you are analytical, driven, structured and curious. You have the capability and interest to quickly learn new things and adapt to new situations. Performing your work you do as a team player and with integrity. Your communication is straightforward and you have the ability to explain complex matters in an understandable way. You are service-minded, have good social skills and an ability to create relationships and networks.
   

  

 An academic background in mathematics and mathematical statistics or other relevant technical education is required. Further, you have experience of programming languages such as R or Python. Skills in Microsoft 365 are helpful. It is preferable if you have started an actuarial education and are committed to completing it. Knowledge of the insurance industry, its current and evolving regulations (such as Solvency 2, statutory accounting rules and IFRS 17) and financial modelling concepts is advantageous. Furthermore, it is preferable if you have prior experience from working with data analytics, artificial intelligence or machine learning.
   

  

 You have advanced language skills in both Swedish and English.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Recruitment Process**
 Welcome with your application to us no later than 31 May 2025. We will review applications continuously, and the position may be filled earlier than the application deadline.
   

  

**Please Attach The Following Documents To Your Application**
* CV
* Cover letter
* Academic grades from university/college


 We believe in having a recruitment process that applies to everyone. As part of the selection, we use psychometric tests to ensure an objective, unbiased, and fair selection.
   

  

 We value the personal meeting to understand the value you can bring to PwC and what we can offer you. The interview process usually consists of multiple stages and various types of interviews. When meeting with HR, you will have a competency-based interview where we examine the personality test you completed before the interview. During the interview with the business, you will have the opportunity to meet with the relevant team to discuss the role. We call for interviews continuously, and we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

title: Engineering Team Lead, Merchant Payouts
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We have an exciting opportunity for an engineering team lead to join our ranks building a bigger and better Wolt. We’re currently on the lookout for an Engineering Team Lead, to join our Merchant Payouts team.
   

  

 The Fintech group as a whole consists of 12 different teams, building financial services used by our Couriers, Merchants and Customers. Those financial services cover a wide range of functionalities, including various payment methods, Invoicing, Anti-Money Laundering processes, Payouts, Cash advances and User Interfaces for a varying group of users who manage all things finance.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 As an Engineering Team Lead, you’ll ensure we do the right things in the right way, acting as a facilitator and striving to make the complex things simple. You’ll see it as your biggest mission to cultivate personal growth of your team members and serve as a servant leader by truly getting to know each team member, having regular 1on1s with feedback, and facilitating goal-setting.
   

  

 You’ll also act as an enabler for the daily and weekly practices and do whatever is needed to help the team succeed. As we work in a highly ownership-driven environment, it will often mean taking a step back and giving autonomy to the team, engaging with stakeholders and partners; on other occasions, you may contribute hands-on if you want and give your guidance
   

  

 You ensure world class engineering practices and raise ambition level while working in a sustainable way in a psychologically safe environment. We’d expect you to know well when to apply which approach.
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
* You know what it takes to develop top-quality software, take care of people and achieve ambitious goals together.
* You come with previous experience in a highly regulated environment, preferably within the FinTech domain.
* You'll be an inspirer, facilitator and enabler for the team to do what they do best by making personal development plans, hosting regular 1on1s and taking part in recruitment.
* You're not afraid to step into action when needed, and most of the time, you are also ready to step back and let the team do its magic.
* We expect you to be a good communicator, willing to serve people outside of your team and liaise with senior stakeholders.
* You’re a product-oriented and proactive problem solver willing to bring up issues in a constructive manner to the team and the whole Wolt Product team.
* The essential tasks in this role are facilitation, communication, helping high performing engineers to focus and bringing them context. But if you are one of those unicorns with leadership abilities & development skills, there could be room for hands-on contribution as well!
* Our teams work with e.g. Kotlin, Go, TypeScript, React, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Kafka, GitHub Actions, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, DataDog, Looker so we also value skills with any of these.


 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Operations Management - Summer Internship
description:
**Operations Management Intern – Summer Internship** 




  





**Location:** 
  Stockholm, Sweden
 



**Duration:** 
  4 months June – September 2025
 



**Compensation:** 
 Non-Paid internship, an exclusive opportunity to work with key leading brands and get a high valued network.
 



  





**About Swedish Cold:** 




 At Swedish Cold, we’re building the future of luxury wellness from the ground up. As a fast-growing startup, we’re redefining premium fitness and recovery for elite clients—from professional athletes to high-net-worth individuals. This is your chance to get in early and shape the backbone of our operations.
 



  





**Your Mission:** 




 As an 
 **Operations Management Intern** 
 , you’ll be a foundational part of our startup team, working shoulder-to-shoulder with leadership to build systems, delight clients, and scale excellence. This isn’t shadowing—it’s owning critical pieces of our business from day one.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 



* **Operational Ownership:** 
  Run key aspects of daily operations—you’ll have real responsibility, not busywork.
* **Elite Client & Partner Engagement:** 
  Work directly with our ultra-premium clientele and top-tier partners.
* **Startup Hustle:** 
  Jump into everything from logistics to experiential design—we’re building the plane while flying it.
* **Process Optimization:** 
  Work closely with leadership to identify and implement improvements that drive efficiency and client satisfaction.


- 


**Who You Are:** 



* A 
 **future leader** 
  who understands that elite results require elite effort.
* A 
 **hands-on problem solver** 
 —you thrive in ambiguity and build structure where none exists.
* Obsessed with 
 **details and excellence** 
 —luxury is in your DNA.
* A 
 **collaborative hustler** 
  who’s as comfortable talking to CEOs as you are rolling up your sleeves.
* Fluent in 
 **Swedish**



  





**Why Intern With Us?** 




  




* **Foundational Experience:** 
  Get startup-scale responsibility at a luxury brand—rare for internships.
* **Direct Access:** 
  Learn from founders and industry experts daily.
* **Career Accelerator:** 
  Prove yourself here, and you’ll have a home as we grow.
* **Performance Bonuses:** 
  Earn rewards for your direct impact.



  





  





**Apply Now!** 





 Send your resume and a 2-sentence pitch on why you’d crush this role to kontakt@swedishcold.se or DM us on Linkedin. - Let’s make this summer your most productive yet!

title: Är du vår nästa Analytics Consultant?
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Design Services
description:
Vi letar nu efter fler kollegor till vår växande grupp datakonsulter; personer som gillar att skapa värde genom data & analys!
   

  

 Våra närmare 100 dataexperter i Sverige jobbar med datalösningar inom nästan alla teknologier, både med och utan cloud. Ett vanligt projekt varierar i längd från en månad till några år, och situationen kan justeras baserat på dina önskemål. Våra kunder finns inom alla branscher, allt från produktutveckling, hälsa, industri och försäkring till kommunikation, bank och elförsörjning.
   

  

 Såhär beskriver vår Analytics konsult Alexandra sitt nuvarande projekt:
   

  

 “Jag hjälper kunden att utveckla en app för att följa upp kostnader i stora projekt, för att se till att man ligger i linje med budgeten och fakturerar enligt plan. Mitt uppdrag hos kunden kommer att breddas framöver då jag nyligen hjälpt till att göra en kartläggning av Power BI-behov i hela verksamheten. Vi har bland annat hittat behov inom kvalitet och hållbarhetsredovisning – vilket jag tycker är extra spännande då det knyter an till mitt intresse för området. Det bästa med uppdraget är samarbetet – jag är del av ett Scrum-team bestående av bolagets egna it-medarbetare och användare. Det är också tryggt att ha Solitas community i ryggen, jag vet att jag aldrig är ensam, det finns alltid hjälp att få av kollegorna”
   

  

**Känner du igen dig i följande?**
* Du diskuterar gärna datavisualiseringar och databaser, och bygger inspirerande dashboards
* Du kan implementera datalösningar som fungerar både för dataexperter och beslutsfattare på företag
* Du lär dig gärna nya teknologier och metoder
* Du har flera års erfarenhet att jobba med visualisering, gärna med Tableau, Power BI samt SQL eller Python
* Du är intresserad och nyfiken av teknologier och data


 Det viktigaste för oss är ändå att du delar våra värderingar, du är omtänksam mot andra och delar gärna din kunskap och vågar stå för det du tror på.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
 Vår företagskultur är väldigt viktig för oss, vi värdesätter låg hierarki, självständighet och ansvar, värdeskapande arbete och trevliga kollegor. Här kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, och här kan du bläddra bland våra tech-bloggar.
   

  

* Flexibilitet och autonomi för att utforma ditt arbete med flextider– läs mer från vår blogg.
* Ständig utveckling: Vi erbjuder kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling för att säkerställa att våra medarbetare ligger längst fram i teknikutvecklingen.
* Innovativ kultur: Arbeta tillsammans med några av de främsta experterna inom data, analys och utveckling


 Utöver detta får du även ta del av följande
 **förmåner** 
 :
   

  

 💰Fast lön oberoende av beläggningsgrad
   

  

 🏦Pensionsavsättning i linje med ITP1 samt möjlighet till löneväxling till ditt pensionssparande vid inkomst över 8,07 inkomstbasbelopp
   

  

 🛋️ Möjligheter till flex för en god work-life-balance
   

  

 🏖️ 30 semesterdagar
   

  

 🩺 Sjukvårdsförsäkring via Skandia för både din mentala och fysiska hälsa som täcker dig även utanför tjänstetid
   

  

 🏋️‍♀️ Friskvårdsbidrag på 5000 kr via Benifex (tidigare Benify).
   

  

 💻 Ett brett nätverk av erfarna specialister från olika områden inom tech att samarbeta med
   

  

 🔗 Intern coach för att stödja ditt välbefinnande
   

  

 🪩 After Work och hobbyaktiviteter; så som “bad movie night” och “board game night”
   

  

 🥐 Fredagsfrukost
   

  

**Vilka är vi?**
 Solita är ett värderingsstyrt konsultbolag med över 2000 medarbetare i 9 länder, varav 230 i Sverige. Vår storlek gör oss tillräckligt stora för att vara en stabil och innovativ arbetsgivare, men samtidigt tillräckligt små för att värna om våra medarbetare och kunder. Med bred kompetens inom digital transformation erbjuder vi en dynamisk arbetsmiljö. Hos oss får du friheten att utvecklas, både professionellt och personligt.
   

  

**Intresserad av att höra mer?** 
 Låter det som en spännande utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan och bli en del av vårt team som ligger i framkant inom data. Om du har några frågor, kontakta rekryteringsansvarig, Sara Lindström sara.lindstrom(at)solita.se.
   

  

**Hur ser processen ut?** 
 I rekryteringsprocessen tror vi på en gedigen och effektiv process. Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande. Om vi ser en potentiell matchning, bjuder vi in dig till ett första möte för att lära känna dig och berätta mer om vår kultur och våra värderingar på Solita. I andra intervjun fokuserar vi på din tekniska kompetens och din erfarenhet. Om allt går bra tar vi oss vidare till sista steget där vi presenterar ett erbjudande och välkomnar dig som ny Solitan!

title: Vice President of Engineering
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Computer and Network Security
description:
Meet
 
 Yubico
 
 : the inventor of the
 
 YubiKey
 
 ––the world's first and leading security key. Our company’s mission is to make secure login easy and available for everyone. Yubico was founded in 2007 by Stina and Jakob Ehrensvard, and recently went public on Nasdaq Stockholm Main Market: YUBICO. Our customers include Fortune 500 companies, hundreds of government agencies and millions of individuals in over 160 countries that rely on Yubico technology to secure access to computers, online services and mobile apps. We  are a global company with a strong company culture and employees located in over 14 countries. Yubico’s  headquarters are based in  Stockholm, Sweden and Santa Clara, CA.  Aligned with our mission to make the internet more secure for everyone, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations helping at-risk individuals through our philanthropic initiative,
 
 Secure it Forward
 
 .
 




  





**At Yubico, we offer:**




  





**Yubico Values:
 
 We work to ensure that our employees have an open space to have their voices amplified to create a workplace where everyone feels like they belong. Aligned with this, our employees have created some pretty cool Employee Resource Groups: YubiPride, YubiBIPOC, YubiSustainability and YubiWomen. Additionally, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations in need all over the world (you can read more about our work here).
 

  





**Social Connection:**

 Relationships and connectedness matter, and we love spending time with our team! Our virtual workspace keeps us connected day-to-day whether it's through Yubico celebrating wins or our buzzing Slack communities. We host an all-team event in a new location every year where we plan for upcoming quarters, set goals, and most importantly, host fun events to encourage team building outside of the workplace. Check out our
 

 Life at Yubico Page
 

 on LinkedIn and our awards
 

 here
 
**.**




  






 The Role:
 




  






 We are seeking a Vice President of Engineering to lead our engineering teams in hardware engineering, firmware development, tools, SDKs & applications development, and manufacturing in our Stockholm office. This executive role will be a key part of the leadership team, responsible for driving the technical vision and execution of Yubico’s engineering strategies, overseeing product development from design to manufacturing, and ensuring that Yubico’s products continue to meet the highest standards of security, performance, and reliability.
 




  






 The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in hardware and firmware engineering, along with exposure to manufacturing processes. You will be responsible for building, leading, and mentoring a high-performing engineering team while collaborating closely with other departments to ensure smooth product development and successful product launches.
 




  






  




**Tasks & Responsibilities:** 
* **Leadership & Team Management:** 
 Build, lead, and mentor Yubico’s engineering teams across hardware engineering, firmware development, and manufacturing. Cultivate a culture of innovation, collaboration, and excellence while ensuring continuous team growth and development
* **Technical Strategy & Vision:** 
 Define and drive the engineering strategy for hardware and firmware systems at Yubico, ensuring alignment with the overall product vision and business goals. Lead the execution of this strategy to create next-generation security products
* **Product Development & Execution:** 
 Oversee the end-to-end product development lifecycle, from initial concept and prototyping to mass production. Ensure all hardware and firmware products are delivered on time, meet security requirements, and exceed quality and reliability
* **Manufacturing & Supply Chain Management:** 
 Collaborate with the operations and manufacturing teams to ensure smooth and efficient production processes. Drive optimization of manufacturing workflows, quality control, and supply chain management to ensure high-quality products and scalability
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration:** 
 Work closely with product management, design, marketing, and sales teams to align engineering efforts with business objectives. Ensure that products meet market needs and user requirements, integrating feedback into future development cycles
* **Innovation & R&D:** 
 Foster a culture of innovation within the engineering team, ensuring that Yubico continues to lead the market with groundbreaking security technologies. Stay informed on industry trends and emerging technologies that can influence future product development
* **Security & Quality Assurance:** 
 Ensure that all engineering processes and products adhere to the highest standards of security, reliability, and performance. Implement and enforce best practices for hardware and firmware testing, verification, and validation
* **Process Optimization:** 
 Continuously evaluate and improve engineering processes, tools, and workflows to increase efficiency, reduce time-to-market, and support scalability. Promote best practices in hardware and firmware development to streamline development efforts
* **Customer Focus:** 
 Engage with customer-facing teams to understand user needs and pain points, ensuring that engineering solutions meet and exceed customer expectations. Leverage market insights to guide product improvements and new product initiatives



  




**Basic Qualifications:** 
* Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field
* Experience:
* 10+ years of experience in hardware and firmware engineering, with a proven ability to design and deliver complex, secure products at scale
* At least 5+ years in a leadership role, managing engineering teams, and collaborating cross-functionally to deliver successful hardware and firmware products
* Strong experience with manufacturing processes, including familiarity with hardware prototyping, assembly, quality control, and scaling production Knowledge of contract manufacturing and managing global supply chains is a plus
* Experience in secure hardware (e.g., smart cards, hardware security modules, encryption devices) and an understanding of security protocols (e.g., FIDO2, U2F, TLS) is highly desirable
* Experience with embedded firmware development (C, C++, low-level programming) and embedded systems
* Proven ability to drive end-to-end product development across hardware and firmware, from design and development to testing, deployment, and production
* Familiarity with hardware design tools (e.g., PCB design, schematic capture) and firmware development tools



  




**Technical Skills:** 
* Strong technical background in hardware engineering, with experience in electrical design, PCB layout, and signal integrity
* In-depth knowledge of embedded systems and firmware development, with the ability to integrate hardware and software components to deliver high-performance, secure products
* Familiarity with manufacturing techniques and processes for high-volume product production (e.g., SMT, PCBA, etc.)
* Understanding of cryptography and security protocols is a major advantage



  




**Leadership & Soft Skills:** 
* Strong leadership and management skills, with the ability to mentor and develop engineering talent while fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and accountability
* Exceptional communication skills, capable of presenting technical topics to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Strategic thinking and a strong business acumen, able to balance short-term product development goals with long-term technological growth and sustainability
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, managing multiple projects while maintaining high standards of quality and performance
* Agility to address rapid shifts in product development and technology needs while ensuring that team members feel heard and that decisions are made collaboratively and inclusively to promote a sense of unity
* Fluency in English is required; proficiency in Swedish is a plus






  




  














  





 We are an equal opportunity employer, we value diversity and uphold an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. We'd love to learn about what you can add to our diverse team.
 



  





 Yubico does not accept agency resumes or referrals so please do not send them to our careers staff or employees. Yubico is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes or referrals.
 



  





 Personal data submitted through this form is used for managing Yubico’s recruitment activities, which include facilitating any application you make, setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing results and selecting candidates, and as otherwise needed in our recruitment and onboarding processes. The use of your personal data may also be necessary prior to entering into a contract with you (that is prior to offering you a job with Yubico). Your personal data will only be used for the purposes for which it was collected and in accordance with the Yubico Privacy Notice. We only keep your personal data for as long as necessary and in compliance with Yubico’s record retention policies. If you have asked us to, we will keep you informed of other opportunities at Yubico. We do this in various ways, including email and by phone. If at any time you do not want us to contact you or use your information as described herein please contact us at jobs@yubico.com to let us know and we will delete all such information. Providing your personal data is voluntary, but necessary to join our talent community, and if you do not agree to provide your data, we will not be able to consider you as part of our talent community.
 



  





 As part of providing the requested service, we will transfer your data to be processed by Lever, Inc., a service provider contracted by Yubico AB and/or its subsidiaries that meets legally mandated privacy requirements. The Yubico Privacy Notice offers more information about Yubico privacy practices, including the lawful basis for processing of personal data, how to lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority, and how to contact Yubico to exercise your data subject rights. In this notice, when we refer to "Yubico", "us", "we" or "our", we mean the Yubico group company or companies that you apply to, or correspond with, and which are responsible for any personal data collected about you.**

title: Enterprise Architect
description:
**Vi på B3 Visab Consulting fokuserar på att stödja finansindustrin med sin affärsutveckling i den digitala ekonomin. Därför söker vi efter engagerade Enterprisearkitekter som vill utforma, utveckla och förfina den övergripande arkitekturen hos bolag i en samhällskritisk bransch.**
 Med över 40 års erfarenhet från området har vi skapat djupa relationer med branschledande aktörer inom bank- och försäkringsindustrin. Vår gedigna erfarenhet och våra seniora konsulter gör oss även till en attraktiv partner för nya, snabbfotade uppstickare. Just nu söker vi fler etablerade enterprisearkitekter med erfarenhet från bank och försäkring.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som vill arbeta i ett företag med sympatiska värderingar, erfarna kollegor och en attraktiv ersättningsmodell. Om du, liksom vi, värnar om en arbetsmiljö där samarbete, prestigelös kunskapsdelning och utveckling frodas, är detta en unik chans för dig att vara med och bidra till vår starka kultur samtidigt som du ges möjlighet att växa i din yrkesroll.
   

  

**Om rollen:**
 Som konsult hos oss ges du möjligheter till intressanta uppdrag hos spännande kunder. Att du har förmågan att skapa relationer och på ett prestigelöst sätt samarbeta i team tror vi är avgörande för att du ska lyckas i dina uppdrag. Uppdragen hos kund varierar men kan bl.a innebära att du kommer att vara ansvarig för att utforma, utveckla och förfina den övergripande arkitekturen, inklusive IT-system, processer och resurser. Detta inkluderar arkitektursstrategi, målarkitektur och lösningsarkitektur som går i linje med den övergripande affärsstrategin samtidigt som prestanda, säkerhet, lagkravsefterlevnad och liknande måste tillgodoses.
   

  

**Vidare ser vi att du har följande kvalifikationer:**
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet från enterprisearkitektrollen.
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet från bank- eller försäkringsområdet.
* Erfarenhet från konsultrollen.
* Certifieringar och erfarenheter inom relevanta områden.
* Arbetar obehindrat på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.
* Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet som verksamhetsarkitekt.


**Vi erbjuder:**
* Attraktiv lönemodell.
* Goda förutsättningar för flexibla arbetstider.
* Möjligheter att gå relevanta utbildningar och ta attraktiva certifikat.
* En fantastisk wellness- och medarbetarsatsning. Läs mer här


**Varför B3 Visab Consulting:**
 B3 Visab Consulting är en del av B3 Consulting Group, ett av Sveriges snabbast växande företag inom IT och management. Således kan vi erbjuda det bästa av två världar. Styrkan hos ett stort börsnoterat bolag i kombination med den härliga samhörigheten som ett mindre bolag erbjuder.
   

  

 Vi är även stolta över att vi nominerats till och vunnit fler olika priser som "Årets Karriärföretag" och som Sveriges bästa bolag enligt ”Great Place to Work”. Vi tror att det beror på vår energi, vårt sätt att välkomna olikheter och våra erfarenheter som vi gärna delar med oss av. En central del av energiskapandet är vår unika wellness-satsning Team B3. Vi tror att medarbetare som mår bra, presterar bra och vill vara engagerade kollegor och goda medmänniskor.
   

  

 De som jobbar kvar hos oss efter många år pratar om friheten att påverka sina uppdrag, arbetstider och utveckling. De talar även om stoltheten över att vara en del av ett bolag som inte bara levererar förstklassigt resultat till sina kunder utan även tar ansvar för samhället i stort bl.a. genom att vara partner till fina initiativ som Women in Tech, Changers Hub, Pink Programming m.fl.
   

  

**Kontakt:**
 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig, så ansök nu! Vi tar inte emot ansökningar vi mail men du är mer än välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Lidia på lidia.hagos@b3.se eller konsultchef Hanna Skoog på +4670-260 12 65 eller VD Susanne Nordvall: +4670-823 57 55.

title: Finance Development Manager, FinTech
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 As a Finance Development Manager, you will be at the forefront of Wolt’s financial strategy, ensuring robust financial process performance, operational efficiency, and financial data consistency. You will work closely with senior leadership and cross-functional teams to drive financial insights and support the company’s continued growth. This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced finance professional who thrives in a fast-paced, innovative environment.
   

  

 As a Finance Development Manager at Wolt you work together with our Finance Process Owners, documenting, clarifying and communicating the finance requirements to the Product Development team for relevant projects in your portfolio. Your portfolio will consist of several different types of projects, but the main focus at the hire will be in revenue recognition and Wolt offerings to merchants. This means working closely with our Product Owners and developers working to improve and further develop our platform.
   

  

 What you'll be doing
   

  

* Support Finance Process Owners and other internal customers with issue scoping and making actionable plans to successfully implement development initiatives
* Partner with Product Owners to ensure finance requirements are considered on relevance in product development and act as a one-point of contact for the finance area towards Product development initiatives
* Manage and drive projects, as per need basis as a Project Manager in the finance core processes
* Identify and drive improvements and harmonization across financial processes, ensuring scalability and efficiency as Wolt expands
* Focus area in the beginning will be the Merchant offering, but the team portfolio is wide range
* Challenge the ways in which we are operating our finance processes and propose solutions for increasing our efficiency or quality and drive harmonized E2E processes
* Support ad-hoc financial projects, including for example expansion and new business initiatives


 Our humble expectations
   

  

* 5 + years of experience from relevant roles in Finance
* Experience from project management, preferably in the area of Finance core processes
* Proof points of processes end-to-end management
* Be comfortable with managing a broad set of stakeholders with efficient communication and with the ability to stand firm when needed
* Technical implementation experience and interest on finance systems and data flows
* Experience in a fast-growing or technology-driven company is highly desirable
* Exceptional problem solving skills and the ability to translate finance requirements into actionable Product development plans
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively across teams and with senior management
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities


 What you’ll get by joining us
   

  

* Opportunity to be part of building something exceptional, in an international environment
* Lots of learning and growth in a globally scaling tech company
* Competitive salary + long term incentive plan available


 Next steps
   

  

 If you are creative, like moving fast, and thrive in a dynamic environment where you get to be proactive and figure out what to do (rather than wait to be told) – then apply today!
   

  

 If you have any further questions about the position, you can turn to: Rafael Rosa, Talent Acquisition Partner - rafael.rosa@external.wolt.com.
   

  

 Please note that
 **we do not accept applications sent by mail** 
 . You should submit your application through our careers website!
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Agil Konsult inom bank och försäkring
description:
**Agil Konsult inom Finansiella Regelverk och Betallösningar**
 På B3 Financial Consulting erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att göra verklig skillnad i stora organisationer, där du blir en viktig nyckelspelare i arbetet med finansiella regelverk och betalningslösningar inom bank och försäkring. Vi söker dig som är en erfaren agil ledare och har ett starkt intresse för innovation, processförbättring och att navigera komplexa regelverk.
   

  

**Din profil:**
* Etablerad konsult på marknaden som är van att jobba i stora organisationer med komplext IT-landskap.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta inom bank och försäkring.
* Vana att hantera finansiella regelverk och betalningslösningar på ett strukturerat och lösningsorienterat sätt.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med ISO-standarder, ramverk och processoptimering.
* Gedigen erfarenhet som agil ledare (t.ex. Epic Owner eller motsvarande), med förmågan att inspirera och vägleda team.
* Erfarenhet av samarbete med Compliance- och Riskavdelningar för att säkerställa att alla projekt följer nödvändiga regler och standarder.
* Du talar och skriver svenska obehindrat.


**Vad vi erbjuder dig:**
* Spännande och utmanande uppdrag där du får arbeta med finansiella regelverk och moderna betalningslösningar.
* En central roll i stora förändringsprojekt där du gör skillnad för både kunder och deras verksamheter.
* Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling som stödjer både din personliga och professionella tillväxt.
* En inkluderande och flexibel arbetsmiljö där dina idéer och initiativ värderas högt.
* Möjlighet att vara en del av ett dynamiskt och innovativt team där vi ständigt strävar efter att ligga i framkant inom digitalisering och affärsutveckling.
* En anställningsmodell med frihet under ansvar som passar entreprenören som vill ha kollegor och erfarenhetsutbyte.


**Om oss:** 
 B3 Financial Consulting är en del av B3 Consulting Group och vi är specialister på digitalisering och transformationsarbete inom finanssektorn. Vi hjälper våra kunder att navigera genom komplexa regelverk och att leda deras förändringsresor framåt. På B3 värdesätter vi mångfald och inkludering och arbetar aktivt för att skapa en miljö där alla känner sig välkomna, hörda och uppskattade.

title: Risk Officer
description:
Lysa’s vision is to set a new standard in savings through automation, efficiency and an unwavering dedication to our customers' best interests. We believe that many institutions work against their customers and we see a significant opportunity to establish a new financial champion.
   

  

 We are on a mission to make it simpler for people to save smarter. To achieve this, we need to continuously develop our product and expand into new markets. We have an outstanding team, but to further accelerate growth, we need more talented colleagues. We are currently seeking a Risk Officer to join our team.
   

  

**The opportunity**
 As a second line Risk Officer, you will play a key role in overseeing and supporting risk management within a financial services group that includes a securities company, a fund management company, and a life insurance company. The role aims to ensure that the company’s risk exposures remain within its risk appetite, and that quantitative methods are used for the analysis, modeling, and monitoring of financial risks.
   

  

 You will report to the Head of Risk Control and work closely with compliance, IT, legal, and product owners, and provide daily risk input to product development, balancing innovation with sound risk management. You will gain broad exposure to regulatory regimes (Solvency II, MiFID II, UCITS) and help shape risk oversight across a fast-growing financial group.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Monitor and evaluate non-financial and financial risks, including market risk, liquidity risk, underwriting risk, and counterparty risk.
* Develop and validate quantitative risk models and contribute to the ORSA process.
* Support executive management and the board with risk analyses and reporting, including key metrics, stress testing, and scenario analysis.
* Follow up on the implementation of the company’s risk management framework and ensure compliance with applicable regulations.
* Act as an advisor to the first line of defense on risk matters and contribute to developing a strong risk culture within the organization.


**What We Are Looking For**
 You are analytical, structured and get things done. You thrive in an environment where you have a great influence and responsibility. You are solution-oriented and have a great commercial understanding and integrity.
   

  

 We believe you share our values at Lysa and that you are eager to join us on our journey to become European champions in savings, investments and pensions. You are confident in navigating a fast-paced, digital environment where change is constant, and you are driven by the challenge of applying your risk and regulatory expertise to ensure robust frameworks that enable innovation and customer-centric solutions. You are motivated by the opportunity to influence how risk is integrated into decision-making and to build robust structures that scale as the company grows.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Minimum of 3-5 years of relevant experience in risk management within an insurance company or other financial institution.
* Proven experience with financial risks and quantitative analysis – e.g., risk modeling, stress testing, or valuation of financial instruments.
* Experience with ORSA processes.
* Strong knowledge of regulatory frameworks such as Solvency II, MiFID II or IFR.
* University degree in finance, mathematics, statistics, actuarial science, or a related field.
* Excellent analytical skills and experience working with large datasets using tools such as Excel, SQL, or similar.


**What We Offer**
 Lysa is one of Sweden’s fastest growing FinTech companies - and the largest provider of digital discretionary portfolio management in the Nordics. Today Lysa has 170 000 paying customers and we manage more than EUR 4bn. We have launched our platform in Denmark and Finland, and also in Germany. Our team of 75 has a mission-driven culture, a high employee Net Promoter Score (eNPS), and we work hard to have a significant impact on the European savings market. You will have the opportunity to participate in Lysa's long-term incentive program and thereby take part in Lysa's long-term growth.
   

  

 We are a highly skilled and motivated team where earning trust and adding value is at the core of our collaborative culture.
   

  

**Department & location**
 This role is part of our second line Risk team. The position is based in Stockholm or Karlskrona, reporting to the Head of Risk Control.
   

  

**Application**
 If you're a highly driven and analytically minded risk professional with a proactive approach, we want to hear from you. Please contact Christofer Seward (christofer.seward@franklinrecruit.se or 073-522 43 42) or Rebecca Forsgren (rebecca.forsgren@franklinrecruit.se or 076-410 78 95).

title: Team Lead, Digital Sales
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
Splunk, a Cisco company, is building a safer and more resilient digital world with an end-to-end full stack platform made for a hybrid, multi-cloud world. Leading enterprises use our unified security and observability platform to keep their digital systems secure and reliable. Our customers love our technology, but it's our caring employees that make Splunk stand out as an amazing career destination. No matter where in the world or what level of the organization, we approach our work with kindness. So bring your work experience, problem-solving skills and talent, of course, but also bring your joy, your passion and all the things that make you, you. Come help organizations be their best, while you reach new heights with a team that has your back.
   

  

 We are currently seeking a highly passionate Digital Sales Team Lead to bring our high-performing ISR/ BDR teams to the next level.
   

  

 What You Get from This Role
   

  

 Our Digital Sales organisation partners with Sales and Marketing to bring Splunk solutions to the most transformative companies in the world. A career at Splunk means challenging yourself and your customers to reach higher - and to have fun doing it. We are seeking a dynamic professional with passion for developing people to join our fast-growing team.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 In this role you will showcase the ability to focus on an organisation’s initiatives, challenges, pain points and partner with an ecosystem of elite Field Sales, technical and operational partners. To bring value to those organisations through our sales process, you will do the following
   

  

* Support Digital Sales Manager to Lead and Manage the Team Supervise and inspire a high-performing team of BDRs/ISRs, helping to ensure they hit individual and team performance targets who will become future ISRs and AEs at Splunk
* Actively engage in sales activities. Demonstrate a hands-on approach by prospecting and driving pipeline
* Pipeline Generation Strategy Collaborate with sales, marketing, and operations teams to execute effective inbound and outbound strategies to maximize pipeline creation
* Lead by example Demonstrate hands-on approach by filling in for short and long-term team members’ absence
* Team Development Provide ongoing coaching, mentoring, and feedback to help team members improve their sales prospecting, lead qualification, and communication skills.
* Daily Operations Be the first point of contact for team members with regards to daily operations; conduct regular check ins, provide feedback and support for professional development Performance Tracking Monitor KPIs and metrics, providing regular updates and performance reports to leadership, while proactively addressing challenges.
* Process Improvement Support the team manager in identifying opportunities to streamline workflows, improve tools, and enhance overall team member efficiency.
* Training & Onboarding Onboard new team members effectively and continuously improve training programs to ensure team readiness and success.
* Alignment with Sales and Partners Partner closely with Account Executives and Sales Managers to ensure smooth hand-offs, alignment on target accounts, and optimization of pipeline conversion.
* Pioneer Technology Adoption Supervise the adoption and usage of available prospecting tools like Outreach, SalesNavigator and Salesforce;


 Who You Are
   

  

* Sales hunter with a can-do mentality
* Open to new approaches and creativity
* Self-disciplined and well-organised
* Persistent and resilient


 What you bring
   

  

* Experience 3+ years of experience in business development, sales, or a similar role in a SaaS or enterprise software environment.
* Leadership Skills Previous experience in coaching and mentoring a team of BDRs or SDRs, with a strong track record of achieving team goals.
* Sales Acumen Solid understanding of inbound and outbound lead qualification processes, sales pipeline generation, and metrics such as SQLs, conversion rates, and booked meetings.
* Coaching Mindset A passion for developing people, empowering them to succeed, and fostering a collaborative team culture.
* Communication Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills with the ability to motivate and inspire.
* Analytical Mindset Ability to analyze performance data, identify trends, and implement data-driven strategies for improvement.
* Language skills Fluency in Swedish and English language, both written and spoken.


**Tools Proficiency Experience using CRM tools (e.g., Salesforce) and sales engagement platforms (e.g., Outreach,TechTarget, Cognism).**
**Splunk, a Cisco company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.**

title: Product Owner to Location and Driver Functions
description:
Scania's R&D department is transforming to become part of TRATON Group R&D. TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 We are now looking for a Product Owner to strengthen our teams within Digitial Connected Functions at TRATON R&D. You will lead the development efforts of your agile teams, focusing on creating customer value and shaping tomorrow's global connected vehicles. This role involves collaborating with various stakeholders and ensuring alignment with the overall Connected Systems strategy.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 Your task is to work with both current solutions and the future. As the solutions we create moving forward are expected to be used globally within TRATON. In your daily work, you will be performing classic Product Owner tasks in an exciting and dynamic environment using the Scaled Agile Framework.
   

  

**You will:**
* Lead the development efforts of your agile teams in alignment with your product roadmap, focusing on incremental customer value deliveries.
* Collaborate closely with other Product Owners, DevSecOps development teams, and stakeholders within SCANIA and the TRATON Group.
* Work with requirements and improvement proposals across Scania and TRATON.
* Set the product strategy and align it with the overall Connected Systems strategy.
* Ensure product development is visible and understandable for all stakeholders using appropriate methods and tools (including Jira).


 The position offers a lot of personal responsibility, a dynamic work environment, high technical level of work and an opportunity to influence the future.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 To do well in this role, you’ll need to be a team player with great people skills. You are a problem solver, good at communicating, and you enjoy a challenge. You’re organized, goal-focused, and fluent in English, both written and spoken. We think you’ll have a university degree in engineering (like embedded systems, mechatronics, or computer science) or similar work experience.
   

  

**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Prior experience in a Product Owner or similar role in an Agile/Scrum environment.
* Familiarity with the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe).
* Experienced in working with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
* A strategic mindset with the ability to align product strategy with organizational goals.


**This Is Us**
 As part of the unit Location and Driver Functions at TRATON R&D, you will have access to a stimulating environment with possibilities to network and collaborate internationally within the TRATON group and within the different Brands. We work with a large product portfolio of Digital Connected Functions including for example connected maps, zone management, remote control, climate control, tachograph and vehicle alarm. We develop high performing location and driver functions both onboard and offboard for all brands within the TRATON group.
   

  

 Within TRATON Group R&D, you are an important part of something bigger. Joining us means gaining access to the ins and outs of the entire transportation industry. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Being bigger also means being stronger. Together with our brands, we have the collective power to transform transportation.
   

  

**We Offer**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include wellness allowance, TRATON result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also host events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than
 **2025-05-23.** 
 Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Ebba Lewerentz (Head of Location and Driver functions) ebba.lewerentz@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Account Executive, LE/GE, GTS
description:
**About Gartner**
 Are you looking for a fast-paced career with outstanding advancement potential at a global market leader? If so, think about Gartner. The world's leading research and advisory company, Gartner (NYSE:IT) delivers the technology-related insight necessary for our clients to make the right business decisions, every day. We are seeking highly motivated, achievement-driven sales associates to contribute to our double-digit growth, backed by the solid infrastructure of a world-class sales organization. In addition to a competitive base salary, uncapped commissions and exceptional benefits, Gartner sales associates can enjoy generous performance-based rewards, including all expenses paid trips to exotic locations around the world. Come be a part of our incredible growth organization!
   

  

**Position Summary**
 The Account Executive is a field-based, direct sales role responsible for both client retention as well as growth through contract expansion and the introduction of new products and services. You will consult with C-level executives to develop and implement an effective, enterprise-wide strategy that maximizes the value delivered by Gartner’s products and services.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Account management with an outcome of increased customer satisfaction and an increase in retention and account growth
* Quota responsibility of $800,000+ of contract value within a territory of major client accounts
* Mastery and consistent execution of Gartner’s sales methodology
* Account planning and territory management
* Managing forecast accuracy on a monthly/quarterly/annual basis
* Maintaining competitive knowledge and focus
* In-depth knowledge of Gartner’s products and services


**Requirements**
* 6-10 years of experience with proven consultative sales, preferably in high technology (services, software, or consultative environment), with evidence of prior success in Sales
* Strong demonstration of intellect, drive, executive presence and sales acumen
* Proven experience building excellent client relationships at C-level within large enterprise organisations
* Strong computer proficiency and presentation skills
* Professional level of Swedish
* Knowledge of the full life cycle of the sales process
* Bachelors or Masters degree – desired


**What Gartner Gives You**
* Uncapped earnings and challenging, but achievable quotas – 85% of our salesforce hit quota and 40-50% secure maximum accelerators every year
* Annual top achievers club in locations such as Miami, Sydney and Monte Carlo
* Unbeatable training and growth opportunities, including an intensive 3-week sales academy for new hires
* Excellent corporate benefits
* The opportunity to sell at C-level and work with some of the brightest minds in the industry


 Your application and the data therein are received and processed by Gartner UK Ltd., which is operating as shared HR service provider for the EMEA entities of the Gartner group. Your application will be shared by Gartner UK Ltd. with those persons within the Gartner group which decide about the steps of your application.
   

  

**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work .
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com .
   

  

 Job Requisition ID:100249
   

  

 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
   

  

 Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy
   

  

**For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.**

title: Senior Solutions Architect , AWS Denmark & Iceland
description:
**Description**
 Are you passionate about cloud technology and helping customers innovate?
   

  

 Join our AWS Solutions Architecture team in Denmark and empower large enterprises across industries to innovate at speed and scale with cloud technologies.
   

  

 Solutions Architects work hand in hand with AWS customers to help them make the most of the Cloud. They are at the crossroads of business and technology and engage with organisations at all stages of cloud adoption. Solutions Architects are responsible for creating and presenting technical content and sharing best practices.
   

  

 They work to understand the customer's business needs and give prescriptive guidance on how to create business value with technology. They help customer's validate their initiatives from ideation to proof of concept. Solutions Architects lead activities such as architecture reviews, white-boarding sessions, demos and technical workshops. They collaborate with other teams such as account management, professional services, Industry experts, support, service teams and the AWS partner ecosystem.
   

  

 Amongst others you will be part of design and building reference architectures, proof of concepts and deploy production workloads on AWS. Provide thought leadership and recommendations on cloud architecture, migration, modernisation and operation. Build strong technical relationships acting as the voice of the customer internally to influence AWS service roadmaps.
   

  

 Come build the future with us.
   

  

 At Amazon you will be encouraged and rewarded for doing what is right for the long-term success of the customer. We value your passion to discover, invent and build on behalf of customers.
   

  

 Amazon has always been, and always will be, committed to diversity and inclusion. We seek builders from all backgrounds to join our teams, and we encourage our employees to bring their authentic, original, and best selves to work.
   

  

 AWS Global Sales drives adoption of the AWS cloud worldwide, enabling customers of all sizes to innovate and expand in the cloud. Our team empowers every customer to grow by providing tailored service, unmatched technology, and unwavering support. We dive deep to understand each customer's unique challenges, then craft innovative solutions that accelerate their success. This customer-first approach is how we built the world's most adopted cloud. Join us and help us grow.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Work directly with strategic customers to accelerate their challenging, mission-critical projects and recommend best-practice architectures in line with their long-term business outcomes
* Build technical relationships with customers and operate as their trusted advisor. The best interests of the customer will shape the guidance you provide.
* Share the voice of the customer to inform the roadmap of AWS features.
* Participate in the creation and sharing of best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts).
* Evangelise and educate customers about AWS technology (e.g. through workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences).
* Contribute to the growth of the Solutions Architecture organisation by interviewing candidates and having a voice in hiring decisions. You will also be helping others develop new skills by mentoring team members and identifying talent needs in the organisation.
* Develop areas of depth in technical domains relevant to our outcomes.


**About The Team**
 Our Solutions Architecture team empowers innovators to invent on behalf of customers. We are obsessed with understanding each customer's unique objectives to deliver optimal architectures tailored to their needs. Our culture celebrates talented, curious, motivated team members who take ownership of projects. We move with urgency, take risks, learn continuously, and maintain a friendly, inclusive environment. Join our team if you are passionate about technology and delighting customers.
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* 10+ years of work experience in Cloud Architecture, Systems Design, Software Development, Infrastructure Architecture, Data Engineering or DevOps across industries.
* Technical Degree (Computer Science, Maths, Engineering or equivalent) and/or relevant tech experience
* Experience in managing complex sales processes with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product and technical challenges
* English business level communication skills written and verbal


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Prior domain experience in enterprise cloud adoption and operating production workloads on AWS
* Knowledge of cloud native design patterns, DevOps practices and AWS services
* Experience from large scale migrations to the cloud
* Experience with or understanding of common enterprise regulations, security and compliance standards
* Public speaking experience or passion for creating technical content


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
